properties.description: Ashburton Hall, Croydon's Community Hub, aims to create a place for local groups, charities, artists and fitness enthusiasts to meet and enjoy and socialise in this beautiful space. The Better Coffee Corner at Ashburton Hall is located right in the heart of Ashburton Park and is open to all. Starting from Monday 4th December, local residents will be able to keep warm, charge a phone and enjoy a friendly chat over a cuppa with our new Warm Spaces Scheme. Feel free to drop-in during the times below and enjoy the company of your community. We'll also be able to sign post to local leisure and sport activities available at the centre.
properties.title: Ashburton Hall & Park

properties.description: A warm space open to all. Includes books for pleasure and learning, free Wi-Fi and computer access. Also available are free hot and cold drinks and activities such as games and puzzles.
properties.title: Ashtead Library

properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 7th November 2023** Our music hubs are designed to bring together all members from the local community for an hour of intergeneration fun. This includes singing, arts&crafts and lots of music to kick start conversations.
properties.title: Banstead Music Hub

properties.description: Button House is open Tuesday - Sunday offering soup of the day and a roll for £2 for 55s in the local community.

properties.description: Lonely people welcome or anyone else who would just like to connect with others in their community. Wednesdays 10am - 1pm. "Coffee Drop In" Warm Space - with hot filter coffee, tea, quality biscuits, opportunity to meet others in the community, scrabble, rummikub, other games, puzzles, hot quality home made soup with bread served at 12 noon, weekly notices, short 'thought for the day', toddler toy area, craft table, notices and free thermal items from the council. Free parking for attendees at KT17 1AD

properties.description: SPACE OPENING ON 5th November 2024** From November 5th St Mary the Virgin Ewell will be running a Warm Hub and Refugee conversation cafe at Ewell Hall, London Rd. We are the church at the heart of Ewell Village and here to serve all people in our community. Please drop in on Tuesdays between 5:45 and 7:00pm. Free hot food, Wi-Fi, games, puzzles, energy and home advice resources, Wheel chair access, free warm thermal items, coffee, tea, biscuits, sometimes a song, lots of other activities and lots of great conversation. St Mary the Virgin, Ewell, KT17 2AY

properties.title: Library at the Phoenix Centre

properties.description: Open from 13/11/2022. Runs every Weds 9.30-12.30 alongside our Advice Cafe which offers free energy advice and other support. Free tea and coffee available during Warm Welcome session. Warm, bright and welcoming, our cafe is open Mon-Thurs 9.30-4.00 (10.00-3.00 in school holidays) serving home made soup, snacks, cakes, cookies and other goodies at affordable prices. We operate a Pay It Forward system and a Community Fridge so food is always available if finances are tight. There is a small enclosed play area for pre-school children, with comfy seating and space to sit, chat, relax or work with wi-fi, books, crafts, puzzles, etc available for all to use.
properties.title: Lower Green Community Centre

properties.description: A welcoming place to drop in, grab a drink and snack and have conversation with others.
properties.title: Monday Drop In at HT Redhill.

properties.description: A warm welcoming space for everyone, Morden leisure centre located in the heart of Morden overlooking Morden Park. Come and visit Cafe located in the reception area providing a great meeting place to relax with a hot drink.
properties.title: Morden Leisure Centre

properties.description: We’re opening spaces to local residents this winter to keep warm, charge a phone and enjoy a friendly chat over a cuppa. Feel free to drop-in during the times below and enjoy the company of your community.
properties.title: Rainbow Leisure Centre

properties.address: The Parish Church Of St. Matthew, Croydon, Surrey CR0 5NQ
properties.description: Every Monday from 2.00pm-4.00pm our hall becomes a community space for a variety of hobbies and activities. These are run by the community for the community. Anyone is welcome to share a hobby or skill and anyone is welcome to join a workshop or activity. They are all free. Or you can come and relax and chat, or enjoy the peace in our quiet area. The activities are based around the '5 ways to wellbeing' which promote good mental and emotional health. To connect, give, be active, keep learning and take notice will hopefully contribute towards a preventative approach to mental ill health. All are welcome. Phone: 020 8681 3147 Email: churchadmin@stmatthew.org.uk
properties.title: Renew 121

properties.address: St. Lawrence Church, Morden, Surrey SM4 5QT
properties.description: Starting again Thursday 2nd November 2023. Every Thursday, 1-3pm, we’ll have the heating on – come and get welcomed, get warm, and have a cuppa. Free – Warm – Safe – Welcoming
properties.title: St Lawrence Church Warm Space

properties.description: A warm space open to all
properties.title: St Luke's Church, Reigate

properties.address: Croham Road / Croham Park Avenue, South Croydon, Croydon CR2 7HF
properties.description: We are using our lovely Jubilee Room on the third Thursday afternoon of every month . We offer hot and cold refreshments from 3.30 and a home-cooked supper for guests at around 5.30. We chat, listen, play games, read, chill, draw, puzzle, surf and just relax together. Most of our guests have had some challenges in their lives and find our space safe, open and affirming. All volunteers are DBS checked. We welcome people of all ages but currently our guests are all adults. Those under 14 should be accompanied by an adult please. Please call or text ahead if you are coming so we know numbers for catering. We have quiet space as well as board games, etc available.
properties.title: St Paul's United Reformed Church

properties.description: Organisation running the Warm Centre: St John's Church First line of address of Warm Centre venue: 251 Eden Park Avenue Town: Beckenham County: Kent Postcode - please enter full postcode: BR3 3JN Contact email for public enquiries: office@stjohnsbeckenham.org Phone number for public enquiries: 0208 6503515 Enter your website: https://www.stjohnsbeckenham.org/green-bird-cafe Enter details of any social media accounts if you would like to engage with us and others online: St John's Church Beckenham Facebook page Please provide details of your open times. e.g Mondays 10-2pm and Fridays 1pm- 3pm: Wednesday - Saturday 9.30am-2.00pm Do you provide teas/coffees?: yes Are the teas/coffees free of charge?: no Please provide a short summary of what you offer and at what times/days. This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: A warm welcoming community cafe open to everyone. On Tuesday mornings the cafe is closed for our Bavby & Toddler Group for ages 0-5 from 9.15am-11.00am. Wednesday - Saturday the cafe is open to all serving barista coffee, hot & cold drinks, homemade cakes and hot and cold lunch options. Board games and books are free to use for children. St Christopher's hospice host a drop in bereavement group in the cafe on Thursday mornings. The cafe hosts a paid for monthly Nest craft workshop. Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: Runs throughout the year Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know: The Green Bird Cafe is a community cafe part of the outreach of St John's Church Beckenham largely run by volunteers.

Each class is 45 mins followed by social time Do you provide teas/coffees?: no Are the teas/coffees free of charge?: Please provide a short summary of what you offer and at what times/days. This might include, for example:- warm welcoming place to relax; games and other activities; phone charging points; hot f...: We offer a variety of exercise classes for older people - over 60's - across the borough of Bromley. At some venues we follow the class with social time and tea and coffee, donations welcome. Our classes are dementia friendly and carers attend free. Please contact us to find out full details and let us know you are coming. We look foward to seeing you. Please provide any information as to the likely start and end dates of the Warm Centre, e.g opening 1st Dec 2023 and expected to run to end of Feb 2024 If activities run throughout the year pleas...: Activities run all year Please tell us any other information you would like the public to know: Join us for a free taster and to meet the team and our volunteers. Following registration each class is £6.75 carers attend free.

properties.address: Rockhmapton Road, South Croydon, Surrey, CR2 7AQ, United Kingdom
properties.description:
Our lounge is based in the Gallery in Emmanuel Centre.

Open every Friday 10am-4pm

Light refreshments all day, light lunch of soup and roll, (Rolls, wraps, fillings in the summer months).

 Time to chat, read a newspaper, just sit, do a puzzle, weekly craft activities, meet new people or be on your own in a quiet reflective space to be still or pray. 

A very friendly space where everyone is welcome, regardless of age. 

Pop in for a quick drink/chat or come and stay as long as you wish

Selam English classes for women (Tuesday and Thursday morning)


Keep Fit for Older people (Friday morning)

Circuit training (Tuesday evening)

Badminton Club (Wednesday evening)


Bumps and Babies (Thursday afternoon)

Emmanuel toddlers (Wednesday morning)

Saturdads (Saturday morning)


Church service (Sunday morning)

The Rock service (Sunday morning)

Friday Rockz service (Friday evening)

20’s-30’s Pot Luck Cafe (Tuesday, Thursday, Sunday)

hours._text: Monthly - first Friday of the month from 11am to 12.30pm
Open: 7 days per week 10:00 to 15:00 Closed 24th, 26th, 31st Dec and 1st Jan NB. Open Christmas day We are mainly an adult Warm Hub – but children with parents, carers, grandparents very welcome.

Our Warm Wednesdays programme will operate every Wednesday (including over the Christmas period) until the end of February. From 09.000 hot drinks will be available. A choice of soups and a buttered roll will be on offer from 12.30-14.00. From 14.00 we will serve hot drinks and homemade cakes. From 15.00 the focus will be on providing an after-school club with spaces for homework, reading, playing and boardgames. At 17.00 we will serve a hot meal and dessert.
